In 2019, the second year of drought, an east coast shortfall was supplied in part by Canadian imports. But with the world gripped by the COVID pandemic, Brooks suggests there is no guarantee foreign-sourced wheat will be available this time.

After Donald Trump maligned the developing world in 2018, with the dismissive phrase “shithole countries,” I wrote that no one was coming to save us from the president. Now, in the midst of a pandemic, we see exactly what that means.

Worrying about an economic downturn during a pandemic is too late.

The immediate health and safety of the population is the priority. 

Keeping schools open to avoid hitting the economy, risks the health and safety of the population.

I don't know who needs to hear this but the economy exists to serve the population - not the other way around. 

If it is not robust enough to support us through a pandemic lockdown - a thoroughly modelled and effective response - then the economy has been mismanaged.

The prudent thing to do during this COVID-19 pandemic is to practice social - distancing, and act as if you have the virus with hygiene practices. This is not a burden, but rather an “act of love” to those who might be more vulnerable than us.
